SENT.plain: An unusual case of pseudolymphoma of the thyroid is reported
The tumor was histologically characterized by good demarcation, mature lymphocytes with prominent follicle formation and germinal centers, and mature plasma cells
Immunohistochemical staining revealed a similar distribution of T- and B-cells to reactive lymph nodes and a polyclonal nature of the plasma cell infiltrate
These findings are closely related to the entity, pseudolymphoma in other organs
Differential diagnosis from follicular lymphoma or ectopic thymic tissue is discussed
